title.native: デジモンアドベンチャー:

description:
It's the year 2020. The Network has become something humans can no longer do without in their daily lives. But what humans don't know is that on the other side of the Network is the Digital World, a realm of light and darkness. Nor are they aware of the Digimon who live there.

Widespread Network difficulties arise, centered around the Tokyo area. Traffic signals blink chaotically, public outdoor TVs display garbled text, and so on. The news reports it as a case of cyberterrorism.

Fifth grader Taichi Yagami stayed home by himself to get ready for a weekend summer camp, but his mother and little sister Hikari went to Shibuya, and now they're aboard a runaway train. Taichi Hurries to Shibuya to save his mother and sister, but the instant he heads toward the station platform... a strange phenomenon befalls the DigiDestined, and Taichi goes to the Digital World! The DigiDestined meet their partner Digimon, and they're faced with an adventure into the unknown...!

(Source: FUJI TELEVISION NETWORK, INC.)

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Angels
tags.description: Prominently features spiritual beings usually represented with wings and halos and believed to be attendants of God.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Proxy Battle
tags.description: A proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode.

title.native: デジモンアドベンチャー
デジモンアドベンチャーVテイマー01 〜新たなる勇気〜

name.native: テレビニュースのキャスター

node.description:
He's credited on all relevant media as the creator of the original concept and character designs for the virtual pet franchise, Digimon. However, nothing is known about Hongo as an individual.

The name is actually a pseudonym for the three most important figures in the creation of the Digimon franchise: Aki Maita, one of the two creators of the original Tamagotchi; Hiroshi Izawa, the author of the first Digimon manga; and Takeichi Hongo, the director of marketing for Bandai.

(Source: Digimon Wikia)
He is a professional screenwriter for anime, drama and theater and is a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.
Mitsuka is an animator, storyboarder, episode director, and director currently working at Toei Animation.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/中鶴勝祥)

Originating from [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/). Most known for his work in the [Digimon](https://anilist.co/anime/552/) franchise.

__[Website](https://fujikawachiai.com/profile/)__ | __[Artist Profile (Nippon Columbia)](https://columbia.jp/artist-info/fujikawachiai/prof.html)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/fujikawachiai)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/fujikawa_chiai/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCPn4XA6Gb2u8y_FXXtrHW7w)__

__Height:__ 162 cm
__Graduated:__ Okayama Prefectural Kasaoka Commercial High School

__Introduction:__
Chiai Fujikawa is a Japanese vocalist and lyricist under record label Nippon Columbia (2018-). Before going solo she was a lead singer in the idol group Maneki Kecak, between July of 2015 until her departure from the group in September of 2018. She has additionally performed at the Nippon Budokan, which took place on September 24 of 2018.

Activities as a solo artist began after debuting at "TOKYO CULTURE CULTURE", where she held an Acoustic Live event on November 25 of 2018, this was followed-up with her first album release on May of 2019, titled "Raika".

__Biography:__
After graduating high school, Chiai aimed to become a singer while working at a factory. She mentions how she wanted to write her own lyrics whenever she became an artist, so she had been writing poems in her notebooks since she was a student. Whenever she came up with a word, sentence, or anything that could be used in a song, she would write it in a notepad she kept on her phone.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ToshiSahashi)

__Toshihiko Sahashi__ is a Japanese composer and arranger. He graduated from Tokyo National University of Fine Arts and Music in 1986. Sahashi has composed music for various anime series (including OVAs, films, and drama CDs), video games, films, dramas, and musicals.

The style of his composition is richly symphonic and classical (occasionally jazz). The use of sophisticated compositional techniques, as well as complicated harmony writing such as fugue can often be heard in his work, demonstrating his solid training in the western classical music. He also uses keyboard instruments to deliver more sentimental soundtracks to good effect.
Kenji Watanabe is the chief designer at WiZ Inc. Responsible for designing various monsters and characters from the "Digimon", "Tamagochi", "Magical Witches", and "Yoicocci" series.
He is a professional screenwriter for anime, drama and theater and is a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yamayama800) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/山口宏_(脚本家%29)

He's Japanese screenwriter and novelist, and one of the founders of Studio [Gonzo](https://anilist.co/studio/3/GONZO).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/setoken) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/瀬藤健嗣)

Started of with photography work, soon switched to directing.
Mitsuka is an animator, storyboarder, episode director, and director currently working at Toei Animation.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/setoken) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/瀬藤健嗣)

Started of with photography work, soon switched to directing.
